entry.title: Ripple CTO: Federal Judges Echo Public Frustration Toward SEC
entry.summary:
Crypto investors have been reacting to the recent lawsuits that the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) filed against some major crypto exchanges. In a recent post, Ripple CTO, David Schwartz, stated that federal judges have started to feel people‚Äôs frustration with the enforcement actions from the SEC.
Schwartz disclosed this information while commenting on the recent court ruling in Coinbase‚Äôs lawsuit against the SEC.
Federal Judges Feeling People‚Äôs Frustration Due To SEC, Ripple CTO

entry.title: Binance Expands Its Reach In Central Asia With New Kazakhstan Platform
entry.summary:
Binance, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange has announced the launch of a regulated digital asset platform in Kazakhstan.¬†
Following its successful application for a permanent license from the AIFC Financial Services Authority (AFSA) last year, Binance can now offer a suite of services to Kazakhstani users, including exchange and conversion services, deposit and withdrawal of fiat, and custody of crypto assets.¬†
According to the announcement, the platform will also expand its range of services and assets available for trading in the future.
Binance Enters Kazakhstan Market
At a press event held on June 20, 2023, government officials, representatives of Kazakhstan‚Äôs banking industry, and Binance Kazakhstan leadership were present to mark the launch of the platform.¬†

entry.title: Ordinal Inscriptions Surge Past 13 Million Amid Game-Changing Recursive Inscription Upgrade
entry.summary:
On June 20, 2023, around 9 p.m. Eastern Time, the tally of Ordinal inscriptions minted on the Bitcoin blockchain surged past 13 million. A mere five days had elapsed since the 12 million milestone was reached, indicating a persistent demand for these inscriptions that shows no signs of diminishing. Moreover, there has been a recent enhancement in the Ordinal inscription technology, enabling a higher level of interconnectedness among the inscriptions.
Demand Soars as Ordinal Inscriptions on Bitcoin Blockchain Surpass 13 Million Mark
Ordinal inscriptions remain significant despite recent criticism. As of this week, a record-breaking 13 million inscriptions have been added to the Bitcoin blockchain, and the trend shows no signs of slowing down. Presently, there are 13,059,248 ordinal insc‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Bitcoin Miner Core Scientific Files Chapter 11 Plan
entry.summary: Holders of the allowed debtor-in-possession claims (DIP) for the bankrupt Bitcoin miner Core Scientific will receive full and final satisfaction of their claims, the company said in a joint Chapter 11 plan filed yesterday (Tuesday). Filed before a bankruptcy court in Texas, the company said its liquidity had increased since it sought Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection last December. It attributed the increase to improved Bitcoin prices, an increase in Bitcoin network hash rate, and a reduction in mining cost. Core Scientific‚Äôs Compensation Plan The holders of the DIP claims will get full payment in cash or other agreed payment alternatives, the plan noted. Moreover, any liens granted to secure the allowed DIP claims would be terminated, removing the secured interest over th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Canada Exposes Crypto Sites Creating Fake Dispute Resolution Organizations
entry.summary:
Crypto trading service providers are allegedly resorting to the use of ‚Äúfictitious‚Äù regulatory bodies in order to enhance their credibility. Consequently, Canadian citizens are now being urged to exercise caution and thoroughly verify the authenticity of such platforms.
The Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA), which consists of provincial and territorial securities regulators in Canada, has issued a warning to investors regarding crypto companies that falsely claim to be authorized by non-existent regulatory or dispute-resolution organizations.
The Canadian Securities Administrators stated:
The websites appear to be credible at first glance, with references to complaint processing, dispute resolution and providing redress to aggrieved investors. But upon closer inspection, the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Singapore MAS Proposes Protocol For Digital Money Use, Partners With Amazon For Trials
entry.summary:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), the financial regulatory body of Singapore, has published a whitepaper outlining the common standards for the use of digital money. This crypto-friendly act is a testament to the growing adoption of digital assets in the island country of Singapore.
MAS Publishes Whitepaper Of Common Protocol For Digital Money Use
On June 21, 2023, the Monetary Authority of Singapore published a whitepaper proposing a standard protocol to specify conditions for the use of digital money. Some of the digital assets that fall under this category include central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), tokenized bank deposits, and stablecoins on a distributed ledger.
The whitepaper was released alongside software prototypes, which demonstrate the Purpose Bound Money (PB‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Competition Was Rather Low' in Mobile Wallet Space, Says Zerion Head of Growth

Taking on MetaMask and contending as a browser-extension wallet.

entry.title: How 1 Simple Question Kickstarted Performance Artist Foodmasku's Plunge Into NFTs
